Sep 29, 2017

JavaOne sessions from the Open Liberty team

Update 2017-10-13: Now with links to JavaOne session videos, where available.

Wow, how time has flown! It’s been just two weeks since Open Liberty went live and we totally forgot to mention we’ll be at JavaOne next week. There’ll be a bunch of JavaOne sessions given by Liberty developers (and emeritus developers) throughout the week. If you want to talk to us, come to one of our sessions, seek us out at the IBM booth, or find us at one of the many evening events.

  • Alasdair Nottingham #OpenLiberty

  • Kevin Sutter #MicroProfile #JavaEE

  • Ian Robinson #OpenLiberty

  • Graham Charters #OpenLiberty #OSGi

  • John Duimovich #Java

  • Emily Jiang #MicroProfile #CDI

  • Geoff Pirie #OpenLiberty

  • Megan Mulholland #UX #visualdesign #branding

  • Erin Schnabel (emeritus) #OpenLiberty #microservices

  • Kate Stanley (emeritus) #OpenLiberty #microservices

  • Holly Cummins (emeritus) #OpenLiberty #IoT #JavaChampion

JavaOne sessions featuring Liberty developers

So, where will you find Liberty developers?

Monday

Opening up Java EE: Panel discussion with Oracle, IBM, Red Hat, and the Eclipse Foundation
Ian Robinson - 4.30pm
video

WebSphere Liberty meets open source
Alasdair Nottingham, Ian Robinson – 5.30pm

Tuesday

Cloud-native Java done right
Alasdair Nottingham, Kevin Sutter – 3pm

Wednesday

Panel: Accelerating the adoption of Java EE 8 with MicroProfile
Kevin Sutter – 11.45am
video

Java versus Node.js versus Swift in the Language Performance Olympics
Graham Charters – 1.45pm

Jump-start your microservices development with Java EE
Kate Stanley, Graham Charters – 1.45pm
video

Thursday

Java, open technologies, and cloud-native development: The next generation of innovation emerges
John Duimovich, Ian Robinson - 9am
video

Some JavaOne sessions featuring former Liberty developers

And if that isn’t enough for you, some of these sessions might be of interest to you:

Introduction to Reactive Systems
Erin Schnabel – 4.30pm

Choosing a NoSQL API and database to avoid tombstones and dragons in Game On!
Erin Schnabel – Wednesday 12.45pm

Thinking strategically about IoT
Holly Cummins – Wednesday 4.30pm

So You Say You Want a Chatbot Revolution
Holly Cummins – Thursday 1.45pm

Talk to them on the booths and get free stuff

If you drop by the IBM Open Liberty, IBM MicroProfile, and IBM Game On! booths, several current and former Liberty developers will be hanging out there. Come and chat to them. They’d love to meet you! And they might even have free t-shirts and other goodies to share…
